abstract: Celebration surrounding Ultimate Fighting Championship's 200th pay-per-view mixed martial arts match underscores sport's rise as viable alternative to boxing, and echoes late-19th century rivalry between boxing and bare-knuckle fighting.

headline.print_headline: Long Before U.F.C. Took On Boxing, Gloves Were Off
headline.main: U.F.C. vs. Boxing: Gloves-On, Gloves-Off-Again Rivalry Dates to 1800s

snippet: U.F.C. 200 is a milestone event for mixed martial arts, which considers itself a rising contender to boxing. The event comes 127 years after a fight that signaled the rise of modern boxing....
lead_paragraph: U.F.C. 200 is a milestone event for mixed martial arts, which considers itself a rising contender to boxing. The event comes 127 years after a fight that signaled the rise of modern boxing.
